title: Gatwick defiant despite commission snub
text:
The boss of Gatwick has maintained that the West Sussex airport is the “only deliverable option” for boosting runway capacity. 
The remarks come after the government appointed Airports Commission recommended a new north-west runway at Heathrow. 
“Gatwick is still very much in the race. The Commission’s report makes clear that expansion at Gatwick is deliverable,” said chief executive Stewart Wingate. 
“It is for the Commission to make a recommendation but it is of course for the Government to decide. So we now enter the most important stage of the process.” 
Although the commission backed Heathrow it has left the door open for Gatwick by saying that the scheme is “feasible”. 
The commission said the Heathrow north-west option presented “the strongest case and [offered] the greatest strategic and economic benefits”. 
The independent Heathrow Hub group proposed the third shortlisted option. 
Captain William “Jock” Lowe and his fellow directors of Heathrow Hub, said: “Heathrow airport is the correct location for expansion for the UK. Our economy, our national transport infrastructure and our international connectivity will be vastly improved by the expansion of Heathrow airport. 
“While we obviously still believe our own concept to extend the runways is superior to Heathrow Airport Ltd.’s third runway option, we congratulate John Holland-Kaye and his team.”
